job_title: Intern - IT Software Engineer, EA EPS
job_description:
• Currently pursuing Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Manufacturing Operations, Supply Chain Management Analytics, or Computer Science/IT.
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Operations, SCRUM teams, Supply Chain, PMO) to gather requirements, deliver solutions, and achieve project objectives.
• Collaborate with internal teams, customers, partners, and stakeholders to define project requirements and scope.
• Gather and refine requirements from Micron supply chain teams to design accurate data models.
• Strong communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams.
• Prior experience or certifications in Blue Yonder or Kinaxis (a plus).
• Hands-on experience with ERP systems and supply planning processes.
• Cannot graduate prior to September 2026.

job_title: 2026 PhD Artificial Intelligence Models Software Engineer Co-Op/Intern
job_description:
• Innovative Research: Work on groundbreaking projects and collaborate with a team of highly skilled industry specialists.
• If you have knowledge/experience with any of the following technical skills (or related areas) and are enthusiastic about this role, we strongly encourage you to apply – Project experience on generative tasks.
• , Pytorch/JAX/ONNX/TensorFlowProject experiences on model compression, quantization, and end-to-end inference optimization Strong knowledge of artificial intelligence, deep learning or machine learningStrong coding skills in Python required, C/C++ skills a plusSkilled in academic paper writing and technical innovationAdditional plus if recent publications include conferences such as NeuRIPS, CVPR, ECCV/ICCV, ICML, ICLR, etcSkills related to LLMs, stable diffusion, NeRF, or text-to-video generation is a plusExperience in optimizing and accelerating NLP/Generative AI models is a plus Project experience on generative tasks.
• , Pytorch/JAX/ONNX/TensorFlowProject experiences on model compression, quantization, and end-to-end inference optimization Strong knowledge of artificial intelligence, deep learning or machine learningStrong coding skills in Python required, C/C++ skills a plusSkilled in academic paper writing and technical innovationAdditional plus if recent publications include conferences such as NeuRIPS, CVPR, ECCV/ICCV, ICML, ICLR, etcSkills related to LLMs, stable diffusion, NeRF, or text-to-video generation is a plusExperience in optimizing and accelerating NLP/Generative AI models is a plus Location: San Jose, CA or Santa Clara, CAOnsite/Hybrid: This role requires the student to work full time (40 hours a week), in either a hybrid or onsite work structure throughout the duration of the co-op/intern termDuration: Summer/Fall Co-op: May 18, 2026 - December 11, 2026 or June 22, 2026 - December 11, 2026Summer Internship: May 18, 2026 - August 7, 2026 or June 22, 2026 – September 11, 2026Fall Internship: September 14, 2026 – December 11, 2026 AMD Partner Hub Authorized Distributors AMD University Program Summer/Fall Co-op: May 18, 2026 - December 11, 2026 or June 22, 2026 - December 11, 2026Summer Internship: May 18, 2026 - August 7, 2026 or June 22, 2026 – September 11, 2026Fall Internship: September 14, 2026 – December 11, 2026 Investor Relations Financial Information Board of Directors Governance Documents SEC Filings San Jose, California.
• Optimize AI Models: Leverage quantization, sparsity, and architecture search methods to optimize and enhance the performance, efficiency, and accuracy of Generative AI models.
• Unlock the full potential of AI technology and enable groundbreaking solutions.
• Collaborate with Experts: Work with software engineers, data scientists, and researchers to integrate AI models into software applications and platforms.
• Learn from the best and work together to achieve seamless integration and optimal performance.
